meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of the aristocracy.
meanings.sent1: She walked aristocratically, with grace and elegance.
meanings.sent2: The queen waved aristocratically to the crowd from her carriage.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted aristocratically around the room, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion stood aristocratically on top of the hill, overlooking the town.
meanings.sent5: His speech was delivered aristocratically, with a refined tone and sophisticated gestures.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a way that is typical of the upper class.
meanings.sent1: She had an aristocratically elegant style of dressing.
meanings.sent2: The aristocratically dressed guests mingled at the exclusive party.
meanings.sent3: The dog sat on the couch, looking aristocratically at the guests entering the room.
meanings.sent4: The antique vase added an aristocratically luxurious touch to the room.
meanings.sent5: His aristocratically refined manners impressed everyone at the event.
